collectors.title: Database
collectors.titleDetails: (38 total Queries, 38 of them unique across 1 Connection)

queries.sql: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>1. Obtain schedules of receivables and prepayments. <strong> (P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>2. Agree totals shown on the lead schedule to backing schedules and the trial balance. <strong>(E & C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>3. Agree comparative figures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements. <strong>(P, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>4. Review receivables for reasonableness and consistency.<strong> (C, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>5. Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>6. Ensure key findings from this section are included in the draft letter of representation, points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>7. Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate. <strong> (P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Trade Receivables</h6>\r\n<p>8. Obtain an aged receivables’ listing and reconcile it to the trade receivables figure shown on the lead schedule. <strong> (C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>9. Consider carrying out a receivables’ circularisation on a sample of trade receivables to confirm the existence of receivables. If a receivables’ circularisation is not undertaken, note why and state what alternative procedures are going to be undertaken. <strong> (V, R & O, E)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>10. Review after-date cash for a sample of trade receivables to confirm they are recoverable. Make enquiries regarding the recoverability of any balances still outstanding. <strong>(V, C, E)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>11. For any outstanding trade receivable balances above performance materiality (either individually or in aggregate) at the date of the audit report, make further enquiries regarding the validity of these receivables. Ensure that any amounts which are deemed to be irrecoverable receivables have an appropriate provision against them.<strong>(V, C, E)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>12. Review all significant credit notes issued post period end to ensure they do not relate to pre period end sales. <strong>(V, C, E)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>13. Ensure that any trade receivables due to be received in foreign currency have been correctly translated at the period end rate and there is an adequate accounting policy note. <strong>(P, C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>14. Review credit balances included on the receivables’ ledger. Consider whether they represent unrecorded sales and if they are a bona fide credit balances consider reclassifying as creditors. <strong>(V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>15. Test cut-off by examining sales invoices and credit notes issued around the period end and ensure recorded in the correct period by reference to underlying documents. <strong>(C, V) </strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>16. Review amounts recoverable on contracts and accrued income to ensure that cut-off has been correctly undertaken. Obtain evidence that these amounts are recoverable. <strong>(C, V) </strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. Check supporting documentation for material ‘other receivables’ and consider their recoverability. (For related party balances this should include obtaining written confirmation of the balance.) <strong>(V & E)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. Review loans to subsidiaries and entities in which the client has a participating interest to determine whether it would be more appropriate to classify these balances as investments. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>19. Ensure that correct cut-off procedures have been applied to loans to subsidiaries and entities in which the client has a participating interest. Specific consideration should be given to:</p> <ul> <li>Management charges;</li> <li>Accrued interest;</li> <li>Dividends still to be received. <strong>(C)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>20. Where loans receivable are denominated in a foreign currency determine by reviewing the loan documentation whether the client or the counterparty bears the risk or rewards of movements in the exchange rate.<strong> (P & V)</strong> </p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>21. Review all receivable balances and ensure that amounts recoverable after more than one year from the reporting date have been identified. Also, where balances are shown as non-current, ensure that the counterparty has the legal right to avoid payment for at least 12 months. <strong> (P)</strong> </p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>22. Where loans are supported by formal loan agreements review these agreements to ensure that none of the clauses trigger the loan being accounted for on a fair value basis. If any loans do need to be accounted for at fair value, complete test 28 below.</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>23. Where balances are due after more than one year, and did not carry a commercial rate of interest at inception consider whether the time value of money is material, and if so, ensure that they are accounted for on an amortised cost basis, and that an appropriate discount rate has been applied . <strong>(V)</strong></p> <p>Subject to materiality the following balances should be considered:-</p> <ul> <li>Retentions;</li> <li>Staff loans;</li> <li>Related party loans;</li> <li>Rent deposits.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Audit tests ~ Prepayments</h6>\r\n<p>24. If prepayments are above performance materiality (either individually or in aggregate), recalculate a sample from source documentation.<strong> (V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Audit tests ~ Financial Instruments</h6>\r\n<p>25. Ensure that IFRS 9 has been applied to all types of financial instruments except those set out in paragraph 2.1 of IFRS 9</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>26. Review the classification of the entity’s financial assets, which should be based on the entity’s business model and the contractual cash flows of the financial asset (known as the “SPPI” test).</p> <p>Ensure that the classification is appropriate.</p> <p><i>See IFRS 9.4.1 for detail. </i></p> <p><i>A financial asset will be classified as subsequently measured at either amortised cost, FVOCI or FVTPL depending on the entity’s business model and the contractual cash flows of the asset</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>27. Despite the considerations above, an entity can choose to designate, on initial recognition, a financial asset at FVTPL if doing so mitigates an “accounting mismatch”. </p>\r\n<p>If this is the case, ensure such an asset has been treated appropriately from initial recognition..</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>28. For any financial asset held at fair value, carry out the following procedures (as appropriate):</p> <ul> <li>• Ascertain how management has determined the fair value (e.g. calculated by management; counter-party valuation received; independent third party valuation received);</li> <li>• Assess and test the bases and assumptions used to calculate/support the fair value;</li> <li>• If management have engaged a third party valuer, undertake the appropriate audit tests on the N audit programme to determine the reliability of the evidence obtained;</li> <li>• Consider the need to appoint an auditor’s expert (as per ISA 620). If this is considered necessary, complete the relevant test on the N audit programme;</li> <li>• Develop your own range of estimates of the fair value and compare against those used by management for reasonableness;</li> <li>• Consider whether any events subsequent to the reporting period end up to the date of the audit report provide any audit evidence.</li> </ul> <p>NB 1: Reliance CANNOT be placed a valuation provided by the counter-party to the financial instrument. This is due to the fact that any such valuation is not independent, and in most cases, does not provide detail of the assumptions, data or models used to support the valuation. </p> <p>NB 2: Auditors are prohibited by the IESBA Code of Ethics from providing valuation services to audit clients where the valuation involves subjectivity and the effect is material to the financial statements.</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>29. Despite the considerations above, an entity can choose to designate, on initial recognition, a financial asset at FVTPL if doing so mitigates an “accounting mismatch”. </p>\r\n<p>If this is the case, ensure such an asset has been treated appropriately from initial recognition.</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>30. For loss allowances on assets held at FVOCI, ensure that the loss allowance has been recognised in OCI rather than reducing the carrying amount of the asset. <strong>(V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>31. Ensure that a loss allowance for expected credit losses has been recognised on:</p> <ul> <li>• Financial assets held at amortised cost;</li> <li>• Financial assets held at FVOCI;</li> <li>• Contract assets;</li> <li>• Lease receivables, and </li> <li>• Certain loan commitments and financial guarantee contracts (see IFRS 9.5.5.1) <strong>(V)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>32. Review the guidance in IFRS 9 on measuring the loss allowance and ensure the entity has followed this. <strong>(V)</strong></p>\r\n<i>Note that there is a simplified approach for typical trade receivable balances (and certain other assets), where the loss allowance is measured at the amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses. See IFRS 9.5.5.15 for detail</i>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Derecognition</h6> <p>33. Financial assets are derecognised when, and only when:</p> <ul> <li>The contractual rights to the cash flows from the financial asset expire; or</li> <li>The entity transfers the financial asset as set out in paragraphs 3.2.4 and 3.2.5 and the transfer qualifies for derecognition in accordance with paragraph 3.2.6.</li> </ul> <p>Where financial assets have been transferred, review the requirements of IFRS 9.3.2.3 to 9.3.2.23 and ensure these have been complied with. <strong>(R&O, CO)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Scrutiny Tests</h6>\r\n<p>34. Scrutinise the sales ledger and sales day book for unusual items. <strong>(CL, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>35. Scrutinise the nominal ledger and cash book for any large or unusual items of income. <strong>(CL, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>For periods commencing on or after 1 January 2019:</h6>\r\n<p>36. Review loans and other debt instruments held at FVTPL for any early repayment features with negative compensation (that is, the difference between the prepayment amount and unpaid amounts of principal and interest). If the negative compensation amount is “reasonable compensation for early termination of the contract”, and the loan is held to collect, the loan can now be carried at amortised cost rather than at FVTPL.</p>\r\n<p>Where such financial assets were previously carried at FVTPL, ensure that the transition requirements per IFRS 9.7.2.29 to 34 are complied with.</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>37. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. Check supporting documentation for material ‘other receivables’ and consider their recoverability. (For related party balances this should include obtaining written confirmation of the balance.) <strong>(V & E)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. Review loans to subsidiaries and entities in which the client has a participating interest to determine whether it would be more appropriate to classify these balances as investments. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>19. Ensure that correct cut-off procedures have been applied to loans to subsidiaries and entities in which the client has a participating interest. Specific consideration should be given to:</p> <ul> <li>Management charges;</li> <li>Accrued interest;</li> <li>Dividends still to be received. <strong>(C)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>20. Where loans receivable are denominated in a foreign currency determine by reviewing the loan documentation whether the client or the counterparty bears the risk or rewards of movements in the exchange rate.<strong> (P & V)</strong> </p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>21. Review all receivable balances and ensure that amounts recoverable after more than one year from the reporting date have been identified. Also, where balances are shown as non-current, ensure that the counterparty has the legal right to avoid payment for at least 12 months. <strong> (P)</strong> </p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>22. Where loans are supported by formal loan agreements review these agreements to ensure that none of the clauses trigger the loan being accounted for on a fair value basis. If any loans do need to be accounted for at fair value, complete test 28 below.</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>23. Where balances are due after more than one year, and did not carry a commercial rate of interest at inception consider whether the time value of money is material, and if so, ensure that they are accounted for on an amortised cost basis, and that an appropriate discount rate has been applied . <strong>(V)</strong></p> <p>Subject to materiality the following balances should be considered:-</p> <ul> <li>Retentions;</li> <li>Staff loans;</li> <li>Related party loans;</li> <li>Rent deposits.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Audit tests ~ Prepayments</h6>\r\n<p>24. If prepayments are above performance materiality (either individually or in aggregate), recalculate a sample from source documentation.<strong> (V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Audit tests ~ Financial Instruments</h6>\r\n<p>25. Ensure that IFRS 9 has been applied to all types of financial instruments except those set out in paragraph 2.1 of IFRS 9</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>26. Review the classification of the entity’s financial assets, which should be based on the entity’s business model and the contractual cash flows of the financial asset (known as the “SPPI” test).</p> <p>Ensure that the classification is appropriate.</p> <p><i>See IFRS 9.4.1 for detail. </i></p> <p><i>A financial asset will be classified as subsequently measured at either amortised cost, FVOCI or FVTPL depending on the entity’s business model and the contractual cash flows of the asset</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>27. Despite the considerations above, an entity can choose to designate, on initial recognition, a financial asset at FVTPL if doing so mitigates an “accounting mismatch”. </p>\r\n<p>If this is the case, ensure such an asset has been treated appropriately from initial recognition..</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>28. For any financial asset held at fair value, carry out the following procedures (as appropriate):</p> <ul> <li>• Ascertain how management has determined the fair value (e.g. calculated by management; counter-party valuation received; independent third party valuation received);</li> <li>• Assess and test the bases and assumptions used to calculate/support the fair value;</li> <li>• If management have engaged a third party valuer, undertake the appropriate audit tests on the N audit programme to determine the reliability of the evidence obtained;</li> <li>• Consider the need to appoint an auditor’s expert (as per ISA 620). If this is considered necessary, complete the relevant test on the N audit programme;</li> <li>• Develop your own range of estimates of the fair value and compare against those used by management for reasonableness;</li> <li>• Consider whether any events subsequent to the reporting period end up to the date of the audit report provide any audit evidence.</li> </ul> <p>NB 1: Reliance CANNOT be placed a valuation provided by the counter-party to the financial instrument. This is due to the fact that any such valuation is not independent, and in most cases, does not provide detail of the assumptions, data or models used to support the valuation. </p> <p>NB 2: Auditors are prohibited by the IESBA Code of Ethics from providing valuation services to audit clients where the valuation involves subjectivity and the effect is material to the financial statements.</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>29. Despite the considerations above, an entity can choose to designate, on initial recognition, a financial asset at FVTPL if doing so mitigates an “accounting mismatch”. </p>\r\n<p>If this is the case, ensure such an asset has been treated appropriately from initial recognition.</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>30. For loss allowances on assets held at FVOCI, ensure that the loss allowance has been recognised in OCI rather than reducing the carrying amount of the asset. <strong>(V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>31. Ensure that a loss allowance for expected credit losses has been recognised on:</p> <ul> <li>• Financial assets held at amortised cost;</li> <li>• Financial assets held at FVOCI;</li> <li>• Contract assets;</li> <li>• Lease receivables, and </li> <li>• Certain loan commitments and financial guarantee contracts (see IFRS 9.5.5.1) <strong>(V)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>32. Review the guidance in IFRS 9 on measuring the loss allowance and ensure the entity has followed this. <strong>(V)</strong></p>\r\n<i>Note that there is a simplified approach for typical trade receivable balances (and certain other assets), where the loss allowance is measured at the amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses. See IFRS 9.5.5.15 for detail</i>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Derecognition</h6> <p>33. Financial assets are derecognised when, and only when:</p> <ul> <li>The contractual rights to the cash flows from the financial asset expire; or</li> <li>The entity transfers the financial asset as set out in paragraphs 3.2.4 and 3.2.5 and the transfer qualifies for derecognition in accordance with paragraph 3.2.6.</li> </ul> <p>Where financial assets have been transferred, review the requirements of IFRS 9.3.2.3 to 9.3.2.23 and ensure these have been complied with. <strong>(R&O, CO)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Scrutiny Tests</h6>\r\n<p>34. Scrutinise the sales ledger and sales day book for unusual items. <strong>(CL, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>35. Scrutinise the nominal ledger and cash book for any large or unusual items of income. <strong>(CL, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>For periods commencing on or after 1 January 2019:</h6>\r\n<p>36. Review loans and other debt instruments held at FVTPL for any early repayment features with negative compensation (that is, the difference between the prepayment amount and unpaid amounts of principal and interest). If the negative compensation amount is “reasonable compensation for early termination of the contract”, and the loan is held to collect, the loan can now be carried at amortised cost rather than at FVTPL.</p>\r\n<p>Where such financial assets were previously carried at FVTPL, ensure that the transition requirements per IFRS 9.7.2.29 to 34 are complied with.</p>', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>37. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.5 F2', '2.5 F2', '23', 'Active', '2024-04-02 18:11:52')

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <p>1.	Obtain schedules of receivables and prepayments. <strong> (P)</strong></p>
    [1] => <p>2.	Agree totals shown on the lead schedule to backing schedules and the trial balance. <strong>(E & C)</strong></p>
    [2] => <p>3.	Agree comparative figures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements. <strong>(P, V)</strong></p>
    [3] => <p>4.	Review receivables for reasonableness and consistency.<strong> (C, V)</strong></p>
    [4] => <p>5.	Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>
    [5] => <p>6.	Ensure key findings from this section are included in the draft letter of representation, points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>
    [6] => <p>7.	Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate. <strong> (P)</strong></p>
    [7] => <h6>Trade Receivables</h6>
<p>8.	Obtain an aged receivables’ listing and reconcile it to the trade receivables figure shown on the lead schedule. <strong> (C)</strong></p>
    [8] => <p>9.	Consider carrying out a receivables’ circularisation on a sample of trade receivables to confirm the existence of receivables.  If a receivables’ circularisation is not undertaken, note why and state what alternative procedures are going to be undertaken. <strong> (V, R & O, E)</strong></p>
    [9] => <p>10.	Review after-date cash for a sample of trade receivables to confirm they are recoverable.  Make enquiries regarding the recoverability of any balances still outstanding.  <strong>(V, C, E)</strong></p>
    [10] => <p>11.	For any outstanding trade receivable balances above performance materiality (either individually or in aggregate) at the date of the audit report, make further enquiries regarding the validity of these receivables.  Ensure that any amounts which are deemed to be irrecoverable receivables have an appropriate provision against them.<strong>(V, C, E)</strong></p>
    [11] => <p>12.	Review all significant credit notes issued post period end to ensure they do not relate to pre period end sales. <strong>(V, C, E)</strong></p>
    [12] => <p>13.	Ensure that any trade receivables due to be received in foreign currency have been correctly translated at the period end rate and there is an adequate accounting policy note.  <strong>(P, C)</strong></p>
    [13] => <p>14.	Review credit balances included on the receivables’ ledger. Consider whether they represent unrecorded sales and if they are a bona fide credit balances consider reclassifying as creditors. <strong>(V)</strong></p>
    [14] => <p>15.	Test cut-off by examining sales invoices and credit notes issued around the period end and ensure recorded in the correct period by reference to underlying documents. <strong>(C, V) </strong></p>
    [15] => <p>16.	Review amounts recoverable on contracts and accrued income to ensure that cut-off has been correctly undertaken. Obtain evidence that these amounts are recoverable.  <strong>(C, V) </strong></p>
    [16] => <p>17.	Check supporting documentation for material ‘other receivables’ and consider their recoverability. (For related party balances this should include obtaining written confirmation of the balance.)    <strong>(V & E)</strong></p>
    [17] => <p>18.	Review loans to subsidiaries and entities in which the client has a participating interest to determine whether it would be more appropriate to classify these balances as investments. <strong>(P)</strong></p>
    [18] => <p>19.	Ensure that correct cut-off procedures have been applied to loans to subsidiaries and entities in which the client has a participating interest. Specific consideration should be given to:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Management charges;</li>
    <li>Accrued interest;</li>
    <li>Dividends still to be received. <strong>(C)</strong></li>
</ul>
    [19] => <p>20.	Where loans receivable are denominated in a foreign currency determine by reviewing the loan documentation whether the client or the counterparty bears the risk or rewards of movements in the exchange rate.<strong> (P & V)</strong> </p>
    [20] => <p>21.	Review all receivable balances and ensure that amounts recoverable after more than one year from the reporting date have been identified.  Also, where balances are shown as non-current, ensure that the counterparty has the legal right to avoid payment for at least 12 months.  <strong> (P)</strong> </p>
    [21] => <p>22.	Where loans are supported by formal loan agreements review these agreements to ensure that none of the clauses trigger the loan being accounted for on a fair value basis. If any loans do need to be accounted for at fair value, complete test 28 below.</p>
    [22] => <p>23.	Where balances are due after more than one year, and did not carry a commercial rate of interest at inception consider whether the time value of money is material, and if so, ensure that they are accounted for on an amortised cost basis, and that an appropriate discount rate has been applied . <strong>(V)</strong></p>
<p>Subject to materiality the following balances should be considered:-</p>
<ul>
    <li>Retentions;</li>
    <li>Staff loans;</li>
    <li>Related party loans;</li>
    <li>Rent deposits.</li>
</ul>
    [23] => <h6>Audit tests ~ Prepayments</h6>
<p>24.	If prepayments are above performance materiality (either individually or in aggregate), recalculate a sample from source documentation.<strong> (V)</strong></p>
    [24] => <h6>Audit tests ~ Financial Instruments</h6>
<p>25.	Ensure that IFRS 9 has been applied to all types of financial instruments except those set out in paragraph 2.1 of IFRS 9</p>
    [25] => <p>26.	Review the classification of the entity’s financial assets, which should be based on the entity’s business model and the contractual cash flows of the financial asset (known as the “SPPI” test).</p>
<p>Ensure that the classification is appropriate.</p>
<p><i>See IFRS 9.4.1 for detail. </i></p>
<p><i>A financial asset will be classified as subsequently measured at either amortised cost, FVOCI or FVTPL depending on the entity’s business model and the contractual cash flows of the asset</i></p>
    [26] => <p>27.	Despite the considerations above, an entity can choose to designate, on initial recognition, a financial asset at FVTPL if doing so mitigates an “accounting mismatch”. </p>
<p>If this is the case, ensure such an asset has been treated appropriately from initial recognition..</p>
    [27] => <p>28.	For any financial asset held at fair value, carry out the following procedures (as appropriate):</p>
<ul>
    <li>•	Ascertain how management has determined the fair value (e.g. calculated by management; counter-party valuation received;  independent third party valuation received);</li>
    <li>•	Assess and test the bases and assumptions used to calculate/support the fair value;</li>
    <li>•	If management have engaged a third party valuer, undertake the appropriate audit tests on the N audit programme to determine the reliability of the evidence obtained;</li>
    <li>•	Consider the need to appoint an auditor’s expert (as per ISA 620). If this is considered necessary, complete the relevant test on the N audit programme;</li>
    <li>•	Develop your own range of estimates of the fair value and compare against those used by management for reasonableness;</li>
    <li>•	Consider whether any events subsequent to the reporting period end up to the date of the audit report provide any audit evidence.</li>
</ul>
<p>NB 1: Reliance CANNOT be placed a valuation provided by the counter-party to the financial instrument. This is due to the fact that any such valuation is not independent, and in most cases, does not provide detail of the assumptions, data or models used to support the valuation. </p>
<p>NB 2: Auditors are prohibited by the IESBA Code of Ethics from providing valuation services to audit clients where the valuation involves subjectivity and the effect is material to the financial statements.</p>
    [28] => <p>29.	Despite the considerations above, an entity can choose to designate, on initial recognition, a financial asset at FVTPL if doing so mitigates an “accounting mismatch”. </p>
<p>If this is the case, ensure such an asset has been treated appropriately from initial recognition.</p>
    [29] => <p>30.	For loss allowances on assets held at FVOCI, ensure that the loss allowance has been recognised in OCI rather than reducing the carrying amount of the asset. <strong>(V)</strong></p>
    [30] => <p>31.	Ensure that a loss allowance for expected credit losses has been recognised on:</p>
<ul>
    <li>•	Financial assets held at amortised cost;</li>
    <li>•	Financial assets held at FVOCI;</li>
    <li>•	Contract assets;</li>
    <li>•	Lease receivables, and </li>
    <li>•	Certain loan commitments and financial guarantee contracts (see IFRS 9.5.5.1)  <strong>(V)</strong></li>
</ul>
    [31] => <p>32.	Review the guidance in IFRS 9 on measuring the loss allowance and ensure the entity has followed this. <strong>(V)</strong></p>
<i>Note that there is a simplified approach for typical trade receivable balances (and certain other assets), where the loss allowance is measured at the amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses. See IFRS 9.5.5.15 for detail</i>
    [32] => <h6>Derecognition</h6>
<p>33.	Financial assets are derecognised when, and only when:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The contractual rights to the cash flows from the financial asset expire; or</li>
    <li>The entity transfers the financial asset as set out in paragraphs 3.2.4 and 3.2.5 and the transfer qualifies for derecognition in accordance with paragraph 3.2.6.</li>
</ul>
<p>Where financial assets have been transferred, review the requirements of IFRS 9.3.2.3 to 9.3.2.23 and ensure these have been complied with.  <strong>(R&O, CO)</strong></p>
    [33] => <h6>Scrutiny Tests</h6>
<p>34.	Scrutinise the sales ledger and sales day book for unusual items.  <strong>(CL, A)</strong></p>
    [34] => <p>35.	Scrutinise the nominal ledger and cash book for any large or unusual items of income. <strong>(CL, A)</strong></p>
    [35] => <h6>For periods commencing on or after 1 January 2019:</h6>
<p>36.	Review loans and other debt instruments held at FVTPL for any early repayment features with negative compensation (that is, the difference between the prepayment amount and unpaid amounts of principal and interest). If the negative compensation amount is “reasonable compensation for early termination of the contract”, and the loan is held to collect, the loan can now be carried at amortised cost rather than at FVTPL.</p>
<p>Where such financial assets were previously carried at FVTPL, ensure that the transition requirements per IFRS 9.7.2.29 to 34 are complied with.</p>
    [36] => <p>37.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>

)
